verses.kjv: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob, which are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, which swear by the name of the LORD, and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth, nor in righteousness.
verses.web: “Hear this, house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel, and have come out of the waters of Judah. You swear by LORD’s name, and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth, nor in righteousness—
verses.ct: Listen to this, descendants of Jacob — you who carry the name of Israel, who trace your roots back to the tribe of Judah. You swear oaths in the LORD's name and speak of the God of Israel, but your words lack truth and sincerity.

verses.kjv: For they call themselves of the holy city, and stay themselves upon the God of Israel; The LORD of hosts is his name.
verses.web: for they call themselves citizens of the holy city, and rely on the God of Israel; LORD of Armies is his name.
verses.ct: You call yourselves citizens of the holy city and claim to rely on the God of Israel — the LORD of Armies is his name.

verses.kjv: I have declared the former things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth, and I shewed them; I did them suddenly, and they came to pass.
verses.web: I have declared the former things from of old. Yes, they went out of my mouth, and I revealed them. I did them suddenly, and they happened.
verses.ct: "Long ago I announced what would happen. The words came from my mouth, and I made them known. Then suddenly I acted, and everything came to pass.

verses.kjv: Because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass;
verses.web: Because I knew that you are obstinate, and your neck is an iron sinew, and your brow bronze;
verses.ct: I did this because I knew how stubborn you are — your neck is stiff as an iron bar, and your forehead is hard as bronze.

verses.kjv: I have even from the beginning declared it to thee; before it came to pass I shewed it thee: lest thou shouldest say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image, hath commanded them.
verses.web: therefore I have declared it to you from of old; before it came to pass I showed it to you; lest you should say, ‘My idol has done them. My engraved image and my molten image has commanded them.’
verses.ct: So I told you about these things long before they happened. I showed you in advance, so you could never say, 'My idol did this,' or 'My carved image and metal statue made this happen.'

verses.kjv: Thou hast heard, see all this; and will not ye declare it? I have shewed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.
verses.web: You have heard it. Now see all this. And you, won’t you declare it? “I have shown you new things from this time, even hidden things, which you have not known.
verses.ct: You've heard all of this — now look at the evidence! Won't you admit it's true? From this point on, I'm revealing new things to you — hidden things you've never known.

verses.kjv: They are created now, and not from the beginning; even before the day when thou heardest them not; lest thou shouldest say, Behold, I knew them.
verses.web: They are created now, and not from of old. Before today, you didn’t hear them, lest you should say, ‘Behold, I knew them.’
verses.ct: These are being created right now, not long ago. Before today you never heard of them, so you can't say, 'Oh, I already knew about that.'

verses.kjv: Yea, thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that time that thine ear was not opened: for I knew that thou wouldest deal very treacherously, and wast called a transgressor from the womb.
verses.web: Yes, you didn’t hear. Yes, you didn’t know. Yes, from of old your ear was not opened, for I knew that you dealt very treacherously, and were called a transgressor from the womb.
verses.ct: No, you didn't hear. You didn't know. Your ears have never been open to these things. I knew full well how treacherous you are — you've been called a rebel since the day you were born.

verses.kjv: For my name’s sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain for thee, that I cut thee not off.
verses.web: For my name’s sake, I will defer my anger, and for my praise, I hold it back for you so that I don’t cut you off.
verses.ct: But for the sake of my name, I hold back my anger. For the sake of my reputation, I restrain myself so I don't destroy you completely.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have refined thee, but not with silver; I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.
verses.web: Behold, I have refined you, but not as silver. I have chosen you in the furnace of affliction.
verses.ct: Look — I have refined you, but not the way silver is refined. Instead, I tested you in the furnace of affliction.

verses.kjv: For mine own sake, even for mine own sake, will I do it: for how should my name be polluted? and I will not give my glory unto another.
verses.web: For my own sake, for my own sake, I will do it; for how would my name be profaned? I will not give my glory to another.
verses.ct: For my own sake — yes, for my own sake — I will act. Why should I let my name be dishonored? I will not hand my glory over to anyone else.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me, O Jacob and Israel, my called; I am he; I am the first, I also am the last.
verses.web: “Listen to me, O Jacob, and Israel my called: I am he. I am the first. I am also the last.
verses.ct: "Listen to me, Jacob — Israel, the one I called. I am the one. I am the first, and I am the last.

verses.kjv: Mine hand also hath laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand hath spanned the heavens: when I call unto them, they stand up together.
verses.web: Yes, my hand has laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand has spread out the heavens. when I call to them, they stand up together.
verses.ct: My own hand laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand stretched out the heavens. When I summon them, they all stand at attention together.

verses.kjv: All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; which among them hath declared these things? The LORD hath loved him: he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall be on the Chaldeans.
verses.web: “Assemble yourselves, all of you, and hear! Who among them has declared these things? He whom LORD loves will do what he likes to Babylon, and his arm will be against the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: All of you, gather together and listen! Which of your idols predicted any of this? The one the LORD loves will carry out his purpose against Babylon, and his power will fall on the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: I, even I, have spoken; yea, I have called him: I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.
verses.web: I, even I, have spoken. Yes, I have called him. I have brought him and he shall make his way prosperous.
verses.ct: I myself have spoken. I called him, I brought him here, and he will succeed in everything he does.

verses.kjv: Come ye near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; from the time that it was, there am I: and now the Lord GOD, and his Spirit, hath sent me.
verses.web: “Come near to me and hear this: “From the beginning I have not spoken in secret; from the time that it happened, I was there.” Now the Lord LORD has sent me with his Spirit.
verses.ct: "Come close to me and hear this: From the very beginning, I have never spoken in secret. From the moment these things began to unfold, I was there." And now the Lord GOD has sent me, along with his Spirit.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; I am the LORD thy God which teacheth thee to profit, which leadeth thee by the way that thou shouldest go.
verses.web: LORD, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says: “I am LORD your God, who teaches you to profit, who leads you by the way that you should go.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: "I am the LORD your God, who teaches you what is best for you, who guides you along the path you should follow.

verses.kjv: O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
verses.web: Oh that you had listened to my commandments! Then your peace would have been like a river and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
verses.ct: If only you had listened to my commands! Then your peace would have flowed like a river, and your righteousness would have rolled in like waves of the sea.

verses.kjv: Thy seed also had been as the sand, and the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.
verses.web: Your offspring also would have been as the sand and the descendants of your body like its grains. His name would not be cut off nor destroyed from before me.”
verses.ct: Your descendants would have been as countless as grains of sand, your children as numerous as particles on the seashore. Your name would never have been cut off or wiped out from my presence."

verses.kjv: Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, with a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, utter it even to the end of the earth; say ye, The LORD hath redeemed his servant Jacob.
verses.web: Leave Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans! With a voice of singing announce this, tell it even to the end of the earth: say, “LORD has redeemed his servant Jacob!”
verses.ct: Leave Babylon! Escape from the Chaldeans! Shout it with joy, announce it, spread the word to the ends of the earth: "The LORD has redeemed his servant Jacob!"

verses.kjv: And they thirsted not when he led them through the deserts: he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them: he clave the rock also, and the waters gushed out.
verses.web: They didn’t thirst when he led them through the deserts. He caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them. He also split the rock and the waters gushed out.
verses.ct: They didn't go thirsty when he led them through the deserts. He made water flow from the rock for them — he split the rock open and water came gushing out.

verses.kjv: There is no peace, saith the LORD, unto the wicked.
verses.web: “There is no peace”, says LORD, “for the wicked.”
verses.ct: "There is no peace," says the LORD, "for the wicked."
